content:
Optional Coverage Rules for Quoting

When you make changes to insured items, insured parties, and coverages on the Quote UI, optional coverage rules run. Which rules run and what the system does depends on what you've done to the quote.

The Vlocity Insurance Quote Lightning web component does not support grandchild coverages. Use the Insurance Quote Commercial LWC if you need the ability to configure coverages at the grandchild level.

Add root product: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation, Relationship rules run
Edit root product: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation, Relationship rules run
Add insured item: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation, Relationship rules run
Edit insured item: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation, Relationship rules run
Delete insured item: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation rules run
Add a grandchild insured item: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation rules run
Edit a grandchild insured item: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation rules run
Delete a grandchild insured item: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation rules run
Add optional coverage: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected rules run
Edit optional coverage: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation rules run
Remove optional coverage: Eligibility, Required Coverage, Default Selected, Validation rules run

For all optional coverage rules, colored messages appear:
Blue = Information message
Yellow = Warning message
Red = Error message

Validation Rules Results are stored in JSONMessage format on the quote line item they apply to. If a validation rule evaluates to true and impacts an attribute on a coverage, a message appears that tells you what the rule requires for the coverage to remain valid.

Relationship Rules:
If a required relationship rule evaluates to true, another optional coverage is required.
If an Exclude relationship rule evaluates to true, the other optional coverage specified in the rule must be excluded from the quote.

Profile-Based Optional Coverage Rules: Customize optional coverage rule behaviors for users based on the user profiles.
Scope of Rule Evaluations: Editing root items, insured items, insured item parties, or coverages can change how optional coverage rules evaluate.
title: Optional Coverage Rules for Quoting in Salesforce
